org.svvrl.goal.core.aut
Class AbstractNRWLikeAcc

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
      org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AutomatonComponent
          org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Acc<StateRun>
              org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AbstractNRWLikeAcc
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, SetListener<State>, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RabinAcc, StreettAcc
public abstract class AbstractNRWLikeAcc
extends Acc<StateRun>
implements SetListener<State>

This is a category of acceptance conditions. Each acceptance condition is a set {(E1, F1), ..., (En, Fn)} where Ei and Fi are sets of states. Here we call (Ei, Fi) an acceptance pair. Rabin condition and Streett condition belong to this category.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:
Serialized Form

setVisible

protected void setVisible(GraphicComponent c,
                          boolean b)
Description copied from class: Acc
Makes a component visible or invisible in this acceptance condition. The effect is the same as removing the component from this acceptance condition but the removal can be recovered.

Specified by:
setVisible in class Acc<StateRun>
Parameters:
c - a component
b - true to make the component visible and invisible otherwise
